titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Nelson Rockefeller Citizenship Day proclamation 1980.024
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:15:48 +0000.

physdesc.extent: in one folder in one oversize box.

did.abstract: Proclamation issued by New York Governor Nelson Rockefeller in regards to establishing September 17 as Citizenship Day in New York State. The proclamation dates from 1962.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Nelson Rockefeller Citizenship Day proclamation, 1980.024, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Nelson Rockefeller (1908-1979) was a politician who served as New York State Governor from 1959 to 1973 and the 41st U.S. Vice President from 1974 to 1977 under President Gerald Ford.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Proclamation issued by New York Governor Nelson Rockefeller in regards to establishing September 17 as Citizenship Day in New York State. The proclamation dates from 1962.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1980.
